content:
At the current growth rate, screens would be around 60% larger by 2025

“WELCOME to the big screens,” boasts Apple of its latest iPhone models, which it announced on September 12th. The supersized-sounding XS Max is the first iPhone to have a display of more than 100 square centimetres (cm2) in area. That puts it level with Samsung’s gargantuan Galaxy Note9, and gives users nearly three times as much screen real-estate as the first iPhone, which appeared in 2007.

When will the supersizing stop? Plotting a simple trend line through Apple’s past upgrades suggests that the screens of its “phablets”—that is, phones that are becoming increasingly like tablets—could reach 160cm2 by 2025. In reality, it will be hard to make them any bigger. The body of the XS Max is actually slightly smaller than that of the iPhone 6 Plus, which Apple unveiled four years ago. Designers have dispensed with the border and the home button in order to fit more screen into a similar-sized device. But some customers, especially women, have complained on social media that the handsets are getting too hefty for their hands. And it’s already difficult to sit down if you have an iPhone 8 Plus in your jeans pocket.

As screens have got bigger, their resolution has increased too, which results in sharper images and graphics, and the potential to display more text in a small space (at least for users with good eyesight). iPhone enthusiasts will enjoy the 3.3m pixels provided by the XS Max, which is more than on the latest iPad. If they are willing to spend $1,100 on a new handset, that is.

ex: n. 星系；银河；银河系；群英
网络 影驰；佳乐喜；洛杉矶银河队
eg2: a galaxy of Hollywood stars
好莱坞影星的荟萃

ex: 网络 三星；三星电子；韩国三星
vt. 分配，分发；免除；执行
vi. 免除，豁免
eg2: In 1978, BI began selling systems that allowed dairy farmers to  feed to their cows automatically.
从1978，BI公司开始出售可以自动分配饲料给母牛的系统给奶牛农场主。
When you make a selection, it changes to a state where it can  the merchandise (let's say a quadruple chocolate candy bar).
在做出选择之后，它就转变到分发商品（比如说一个巧克力棒）的状态。
What they do: Based on a doctor's prescription or a patient's needs, pharmacists dispense medication.
工作内容：药剂师负责根据医师的药方或者病人的需要分配药物。

wp.space enthusiast: 太空探险的热心支持者

ex: n. 狂热者，热心家
eg2: Defoe was an  for Latin America and persuaded the British government to set up a company to trade with the region in 1711.
笛福是进军拉美的狂热支持者，1711年，他曾极力游说英国政府设立一个公司同拉美地区展开贸易。

ex: n. 庄园；工业区；住宅区；工厂区
网络 财产；地产；房地产
eg2: She lives in a tower block on an estate in London.
她住在伦敦某住宅区的一栋高楼里。
Her estate was left to her daughter.
她的遗产全部留给了女儿。

ex: n. 视力；目力
adj. 庞大的，巨大的
eg2: No single figure, much less a private banker, could wield the kind of power in today’s  collapsing markets that Morgan had a hundred years ago.
在今天这个摇摇欲坠的庞大市场上，没有一个人，更不必说一个私人银行家，能够具有摩根在一百年之前的那种权力。
Enzo would be stuck at Tyler's until the place was driven out of business by some still more gargantuan sensorium that sold everything from new spouses to plastic surgery.
恩佐会在泰勒一直混下去，直到这个地方被某个更为庞大的、出售从新配偶到整形手术等所有事物的感官系统赶出市场。
American and Chinese officials, for instance, are betting that their gargantuan spending programs--both of them funded with other people's money--will provide more than just temporary relief.
比如，中国和美国官员正在打赌他们庞大的开支计划——都是使用人民的金钱——将提供远比临时性缓解痛苦更多的效果。

ex: n. 图形
adj. 绘画的；书画的；图样的；图案的
网络 生动的；图解的；图表的

平面设计
a graphic designer
平面设计人员
a graphic account/description of a battle
对战斗的生动叙述╱描述
He kept telling us about his operation, in the most graphic detail .
他不停地向我们绘声绘色地讲述他手术的细节。

移动电话

wp.hefty penalty: 严厉处分;重的;体格健壮的人;强有力地

ex: adj. 重的；肌肉发达的；异常大的
adv. 强有力地；非常
n. 体格健壮的人
n. (Hefty)人名；(英)赫夫蒂；(法)埃夫蒂
eg2: It’s a  sample, with a lot of nurses and pretty good continuity.
这是个非常大的样本，有这么多的护士而且连续性非常的好。
Nearly all of them require hefty financing, which is not easy to find in Washington or in any state capital these days.
几乎所有涉及的计划都需要大量资金，但是最近在华盛顿或任何首府都不容易得到这样的资助。
Over the past month, key foreign firms have agreed to hefty pay hikes for their Chinese employees.
过去一个月，主要的外国公司已经同意为他们的中国雇员大幅度提升工资。

ex: n. 【IT】苹果制造的平板电脑

n. 解决；分辨；解析；决议
网络 分辨率；解析度；决心
eg2: to pass/adopt/carry a resolution
通过一项决议
The government is pressing for an early resolution of the dispute.
政府正在不断敦促早日解决这起纠纷。
The reforms owe a great deal to the resolution of one man.
这些改革主要归功于一个人的坚定决心。
She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
她决定要多走走亲戚。
Have you made any New Year's resolutions(= for example, to give up smoking from 1 January) ?
你有什么新年计划吗？
high-resolution graphics
高清晰度的图形

ex: n. 骗子；赌棍；欺诈犯
eg2: Some of the differences you’ll see if you try this example yourself are more precise layout of text and sharper characters at large font sizes and when zoomed.
如果试用一下这一例子的话，你会发现，在大文字尺寸方面和在缩放时，存在着更精确的文字布局和更清晰的字符这种差异。
One essential tool is adaptive optics technology, which, in effect, takes the twinkle out of the stars, thus providing sharper images from telescopes on the ground than would otherwise be possible.
一个重要的工具就是自适应光学技术，实际上就是通过地面上的望远镜将恒星的闪耀去除，从而比采用其他方法能提供更为明显的图像。
But the trend has been  in America than in most of the rich world, and the disparity has grown.
但是这个趋势在美国比在大多数的发达国家更明显，不同之处开始显现出来。

ex: n. 片剂；药片；碑；丸

维生素片
Take two tablets with water before meals.
每次两片，饭前用水冲服。
water purification tablets
净水丸
We can be very flexible─our entry requirements are not set in tablets of stone(= they can be changed) .
我们可以非常灵活，加入条件并非铁板钉钉。
